_header: God that all hath made and wrought
_description: Obedience man’s first duty — one stanza rhyme royal

CamStJohn193.First Lines:
god that all hath made & wroughtman on molde hym to
                    obey…
CamStJohn193.Last Lines:
…for & we do as þe chirche doþe telleys ynow to
                    vs for þe peyne of hell
CamStJohn193.Note:
Added to originally blank side at end of volume, by a hand of the end of
                    the fifteenth century or beginning of the sixteenth century.
CamStJohn193.Editions:
James,  Montague Rhodes. 
             A Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of St.
                John’s College, Cambridge.
         Cambridge: at the UP, 1913: 229.
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild. 
             A Register of Middle English Religious & Didactic Verse.
         2 vols. London: Oxford University Press for the Bibliographical
            Society: 1916-20: 1.230.
